section.title: jetty

para.programlisting: jetty: context: "/myapp" maxThreads: 100 params: a: a1 b: b2

section.para: "jetty" is a root element of the Jetty configuration and is bound to a ServerFactory object. It supports the following properties:

tr.td: A boolean specifying whether compression gzip compression should be supported. When enabled (default), responses will be compressed if a client indicates it supports compression via "Accept-Encoding: gzip" header.
An object specifying properties of the web connector. See jetty.connector below.
A period in milliseconds specifying how long until an idle thread is terminated.
A map of servlet filter configurations by filter name. See jetty.filters below.
Maximum number of request processing threads in the pool.
Initial number of request processing threads in the pool.
Maximum number of requests to queue if the thread pool is busy.
A map of arbitrary key/value parameters that are used as "init" parameters of the ServletContext.
A map of servlet configurations by servlet name. See jetty.servlets below.
A boolean specifying whether servlet sessions should be supported by Jetty.

td.para: Defines a base location for resources of the Jetty context. It can be a filesystem path, a URL or a special "classpath:" URL (which gives the ability to bundle resources in the app, not unlike a JavaEE .war file).
For security reasons this annotation has to be set explicitly. There's no default.

This setting only makes sense when some form of "default" servlet is in use, that will be responsible for serving static resources. See JettyModule.contributeStaticServlet(..) or JettyModule.contributeDefaultServlet(..). Such servlet will use the path defined here, unless overridden via servlet parameters. For the list fo servlet parameters see Jetty default servlet docs.

section.title: jetty.connector
section.para:
"jetty.connector" element configures a web connector (i.e. an object that listens for network requests for our Jetty-enabled app) and is bound to HttpConnectorFactory. It supports the following properties: "jetty.connector" Element Property Reference
Property Default Description
port 8080 A port the connector listens on.
requestHeaderSize 8192 A max size in bytes of Jetty request headers and GET URLs.
responseHeaderSize 8192 A max size in bytes of Jetty response headers.

section.para: jetty: filters: f1: urlPatterns: - '/a/*/' - '/b/*' params: p1: v1 p2: v2 f2: params: p3: v3 p4: v4TODO
